name: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald about the American Dream's corruption in the Jazz Age.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel by Harper Lee set in the American South during the 1930s, addressing racial injustice.
A dystopian novel by George Orwell portraying a totalitarian regime and its effects on society.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A novel by J.D. Salinger narrated by a teenager who rebels against the 'phony' adult world.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel by Jane Austen exploring themes of love, reputation, and class.

name: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien following the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.

name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling, introducing the wizarding world.

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: A high-fantasy novel series by J.R.R. Tolkien following the quest to destroy the One Ring.

name: The Hunger Games
description: A dystopian novel by Suzanne Collins where teenagers are forced to fight to the death in a televised event.

name: The Da Vinci Code
description: A mystery thriller novel by Dan Brown following symbologist Robert Langdon's quest to solve a murder.

name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
description: A psychological thriller novel by Stieg Larsson involving journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander.

name: The Road
description: A post-apocalyptic novel by Cormac McCarthy following a father and son's journey through a desolate landscape.

name: Gone Girl
description: A mystery thriller novel by Gillian Flynn revolving around the disappearance of a woman named Amy.
